intro: Cotoneaster moupinensis, commonly known as the Chinese cotoneaster, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its dense, rounded growth habit. The plant produces small, white to pink flowers in the spring, followed by bright red berries in the fall. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have serrated margins. Cotoneaster moupinensis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and seasonal color changes.
